raw: Brent crude sinks below $30/bbl as recession fears weigh .

raw: Brent crude LCOc1 futures fell $ 1.32 to settle at $ 28.73 , the first time that benchmark has settled below $ 30 per barrel since 2016 .

raw: It then fell further in post - settlement trade .

raw: “ You ’re getting new demand destruction news coming at you every hour , ” said John Kilduff , a partner at Again Capital Management in New York .
replaced: “ You ’re getting new demand destruction news coming at you every hour , ” said John Kilduff , a partner at Again Capital Management in New York .

raw: Amid the loss of demand because of the pandemic , Saudi Arabia and Russia remain embroiled in a price war that erupted after the two top producers failed to agree to extend supply curbs to support the market .
replaced: Amid the loss of demand because of the coronavirus pandemic , Saudi Arabia and Russia  Saudi Arabia and Russia remain embroiled in a price war that erupted after the two top producers failed to agree to extend supply curbs to support the market .

raw: The Saudi energy ministry said on Tuesday that the kingdom ’s crude exports are set to rise in coming months to more than 10 million barrels per day , as it plans to use more gas for power rather than burning crude .
replaced: The Saudi energy ministry said on Tuesday that Saudi Arabia ’s crude exports are set to rise in coming months to more than 10 million barrels per day , as Saudi Arabia plans to use more gas for power rather than burning crude .

raw: Brent ’s premium over WTI WTCLc1 - LCOc1 has narrowed sharply to 67 cents a barrel , reaching levels not seen since November 2016 .
replaced: Brent ’s premium over WTI has narrowed sharply to 67 cents a barrel , reaching levels not seen since November 2016 .

raw: Brent , the international benchmark , reacts more to supply from non - U.S. producers , so the anticipated increase in output from Saudi Arabia and Russia has hit that benchmark harder than WTI .
replaced: Brent reacts more to supply from non - U.S. producers , so the anticipated increase in output from Saudi Arabia and Russia  Saudi Arabia and Russia has hit Brent harder than WTI .

raw: When that premium - also known as the arbitrage - narrows , U.S. exports become less attractive because of the cost of shipping them .
replaced: When that premium - also known as the arbitrage - narrows , U.S. exports become less attractive because of the cost of shipping U.S. exports .

raw: “ Lower priced Brent will be attracting additional cargoes towards Europe while the comparatively high priced WTI will be enticing imports into the U.S. while at the same time , curtailing export activity as the Saudis attempt to re - gain some long lost market share , ” said Jim Ritterbusch , president of Ritterbusch and Associates in Galena , Illinois , in a report .

raw: Other countries and companies are planning similar measures to fill storage tanks .
